taskbody.context: Exporting refers to extracting translated data from Design Studio (DS) and displaying it in a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet, which allows you to make edits. Any edits or new data on the spreadsheet can be imported back into DS (see section Importing Excel translation files ). Exporting a Microsoft Excel translation file involves the general document generation process. The generated Excel file will contain the default language and all other languages of interest.

step.cmd: Generate the documentation of the project in which you want to view its translation file.

step.cmd: To view the translation file, go to the Package Explorer view pane and from the selected project's hierarchy tree, select Documentation\Doc\Translation.xls .
Before you start to edit, clean up the file by keeping only required columns (e.g., translation key, language of reference, and language to update).
step.info: Removed languages do not affect the models translations during the importation. Report Key and Columns suffixed with HTML are produced for Actuate reports and are ignored during the importation.
